title: Harris Bankcorp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Workers' Compensation
description: Workers' compensation costs have soared in the region over the last decade, fueled by rising health-care costs, leaving the states struggling to cut spending on programs to compensate employees for work-related injury or disease. For example, while new claims in New York have not gone up appreciably in the past ten years, payments have tripled, and medical payments alone increased 30 percent from 1991 to 1992. The premiums for workers' compensation insurance, which businesses are required to carry, went up 14.4 percent in New York on Oct. 1. Connecticut cut costs in June by reducing insurance premiums 17.5 percent and lowering minimum benefits.

title: New Hispanic School Wasn't Ready to Open
description: To the Editor:

title: Pursuing Fairness in Big Prudential Settlement
description: Irving M. Pollack, a father of modern securities regulation, is a judicious man steeped in the ways of Wall Street, so he is not about to come right out and reveal his deepest convictions about the Prudential Securities case. But given his life work as a Government crusader, it is perhaps safe to say that the allegations against Prudential turn his stomach.

title: A SWEETENED OFFER INTENSIFIES BATTLE TO BUY PARAMOUNT
description: Rather than let a rival walk away with its long-sought prize, Viacom Inc., the friendly suitor in the bidding war over Paramount Communications Inc., decided yesterday to match the competition.

title: Irving Torgoff, 75, L.I.U. Star in 30's and N.B.A. Player
description: Irving Torgoff, a star college basketball player and a leading pro player in the early days of the National Basketball Association, died on Thursday in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. He was 75 and lived in Lighthouse Point, Fla.

title: No Headline
description: There's a real dilemma here. The economy is starting to move in the right direction. We think it's good to tell people that, because it helps increase confidence, but when so many people and communities are still hurting, you also don't want to sound out of touch with their plight. -- GENE SPERLING, an assistant to the President for economic policy. [ A14:4. ]

title: Bridge
description: Shouting orally at the bridge table is always discouraged. Shouting technically is another matter. That is often welcomed, sometimes by an opponent. An example is the diagramed deal, played two decades ago. The declarer was Richard Khautin of Manhattan, whose death three weeks ago deprived the New York bridge community of one of its most popular members.

title: A Singular Defense Team; Religion and Variety of Styles Help Set Lawyers Apart in Trade Center Bombing Trial
description: There comes a moment in the trial of four men in the bombing of the World Trade Center when worlds mingle and sometimes clash.

title: British Poll Says Gypsies Face the Most Bias
description: Nearly one in three Britons would prefer not to have Arabs or Pakistanis as neighbors, and two of three say they do not want to live near Gypsies, according to a nationwide survey on British attitudes toward minorities.

title: Sports of The Times: World Series; Joe Carter Puts an End to the World Series
description: THERE was a fin-de-siecle gloom hanging over the 1993 World Series. Last year the barbarians ransacked the commissioner's office. This year the vandals besieged the ancient baseball tradition of champions-only-need-apply. Revolution by ownership. And next year, who knows?

DIALOGUE: Staten Island Fights City Hall;
Don't Secede
description: New York City is far from perfect, but to Staten Islanders a unified New York is a matter of dollars and cents. Secession would mean an increase in taxes, a loss of jobs, cuts in services and pressure to overdevelop open space, wetlands and our shoreline.

His wife, JANE MARINO, a costume designer who has done the clothes for "Kate and Allie" and "Beverly Hills 90210" has always wanted to do opera costumes.

title: Is the Economy Strengthening? White House Officials, Cautiously, Say Yes
description: After puzzling for months over why lower interest rates have not produced faster growth, Clinton Administration officials say they are now confident that the economy has turned the corner and is finally on a path of steady recovery.

title: Michelle Love, Michael Marchildon

title: Review/Music; A Vocally Outsize 'Tosca'
description: Franco Zeffirelli's sprawling production of "Tosca" at the Met poses considerable challenges to the mere mortals who must sing within it. The opera can become a contest of simply making oneself heard. In a cast change on Wednesday night, Janis Martin was the clear winner over her male rivals, plowing across the lead role in high diva style. (Her tone suffered as a result: notes in the upper range had a rough finish and sometimes broke apart altogether.)

description: It's the plot of a hundred cold-war novels, and who knows how many pre-1990 Hollywood films:

title: DIALOGUE: Staten Island Fights City Hall; Alone, We're Better Off
description: In the 1894 referendum that approved the consolidation of the City of New York, the strongest support -- 78 percent -- came from Staten Island. How times have changed! This Election Day, Staten Islanders will vote on a proposal to ask the State Legislature to let them form a separate city, and I will be voting yes.

(Tiny) Rowland, the Saudi financier Adnan Khashoggi and officials representing the Palestine Liberation Organization concerning Mideast investments has resulted in a declared end to Mr. Rowland's expensive legal battle over the ownership of Harrods, London's famous department store.

title: Caveat Venditor
description: Once again, companies in the United States, Europe and Japan are helping a third world dictatorship acquire technology that can be used to develop weapons of mass destruction. The equipment and materials they are selling are not leaking out inadvertently, but going out with the approval of the export-control authorities of their governments.

title: Rivals Wage Fierce Debate In New Jersey
description: Gov. Jim Florio and his Republican rival, Christine Todd Whitman, held their third and most freewheeling debate today, frequently cutting each other off, talking over each other and uttering sarcastic asides in their last scheduled encounter before Election Day.

title: Review/Music; Chamber Society's 25th Anniversary
description: Lincoln Center took a chance when it established a resident Chamber Music Society in 1969. Although not entirely moribund, chamber music was a backwater then. Several string quartets and mixed-timbre groups toured and made recordings, and depending on how one approached it, the repertory was either the nectar of connoisseurs or the height of elitist stuffiness.

title: Plot by Baghdad to Assassinate Bush Is Questioned
description: The evidence of an Iraqi assassination plot against George Bush, the basis for a United States missile attack in June on the intelligence headquarters in Baghdad, was significantly weaker than the Clinton Administration asserted, a new article says.

title: Bombing Causes Delay in British-Irish Talks
description: A day after 10 people were killed here by an Irish Republican Army bomb, the British and Irish Governments today postponed a meeting they had planned to hold on Wednesday in Belfast to discuss peace prospects for Northern Ireland.

title: Review/Music; Masur's Gewandhaus: A Display of Tradition And Maybe the Future
description: There were times, during the performances by the Leipzig Gewandhaus Orchestra in Avery Fisher Hall on Friday night, when a listener was granted a glimpse of the musical future. Kurt Masur, Kapellmeister of the 250-year-old orchestra since 1970, was not only displaying the distinguished ensemble's natural sense of breath and gesture, he was also revealing how he might continue to transform his local orchestra, the 151-year-old New York Philharmonic, during coming seasons.

title: Review/Music; Celestial Romance and the Darker Side
description: People in Austin must think a lot about rain, angels, card games and open roads. Or so it seemed on Wednesday night at the Lone Star Roadhouse, the New York stop for "Songwriter: Austin on the Road," a tour by David Halley, Jo Carol Pierce, Jimmy Lafave and Michael Fracasso. The four songwriters sat side by side -- Ms. Pierce at an electric piano, the other three with guitars -- and played songs, sometimes alone, often with Mr. Halley adding lead guitar.

title: Washington Talk; Ahead of the Health Bill, They Jockey
description: In a week when little seemed to be happening with the Clinton effort to overhaul health care, the Senate offered intricate examples of the indirect maneuvering this issue will demand for the next year or so.

title: Police Seek Links In 2 Disappearances
description: Police officials in New York State who are trying to find a missing 12-year-old girl have sent an investigator to Massachusetts, where the body of another girl was found on Saturday.

title: Fearful Rural Haitians Yearn for Aristide's Return
description: For the people of this lush green hamlet set amid eroded hills, the debate in the United States about the mental health of their President seems cruelly sterile. After two years of hardship and violence under military rule, no hope rings more fervently than for the return of the Rev. Jean-Bertrand Aristide.

title: Corrections
description: An article on Wednesday about Russia's consideration of military intervention to protect the Georgian Government from rebel attack misstated the year the rebel leader, Zviad K. Gamsakhurdia, was ousted as President. It was January 1992, not January 1991.

title: Pulse Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Re-elect Governor Florio
description: America's politicians are seeking an answer from next week's election in New Jersey. Is it possible to survive after raising taxes? New Jersey, meanwhile, seeks a capable governor. We recommend re-electing the one they have.

title: Mountaineer Bankshares of West Virginia Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Essay; Sleazy Senate Inquiry
description: In a cynical attempt to make Bob Packwood a scapegoat for generations of Congressional sexism, the Senate Ethics Committee put Americans on notice: no private diary is safe from government investigators.

title: Corrections
description: An article in Business Day on Oct. 13, about Dean Witter, Discover & Company's agreement to sell more of the Allstate Corporation's insurance products, misstated the relationship of Allstate and Sears, Roebuck & Company. Sears sold about 20 percent of Allstate to the public earlier this year, but it still owns 80 percent.

title: MOGADISHU MARCH MAY STIR VIOLENCE
description: This city was braced today for a possible eruption of factional violence after the United Nations failed to dissuade a Somali faction that opposes Gen. Mohammed Farah Aidid from directing a "peace" march on Monday into southern Mogadishu, which is controlled by General Aidid.

title: The Blue Jays Tease but Can't Be Caught
description: The team Paul Molitor played for last year finished four games behind the Toronto Blue Jays.

title: Abroad at Home; Warning: Hysteria Ahead
description: You are an immigrant from Ireland, five years in the United States. You and your wife are expecting to become citizens soon.

title: Daneyko Doubles His Fun As a Defender for Devils
description: There are smiling faces galore around the streaking Devils these days, but a lucrative four-year contract just about sealed and delivered makes Ken Daneyko's smile more radiant than the rest.

title: Campaign Stop: A periodic report on neighborhood reaction to the mayoral race. -- 4. St. Albans, Queens; In St. Albans, Black Voters Express Faith in Dinkins, Wariness of Giuliani
description: When police stepped up patrols recently in St. Albans, Queens, Rodney Williams, a 20-year-old college student, was pleased, believing it would help reduce the selling of crack in the neighborhood.

title: Ms. Bansavage, Mr. Potter
description: Elisabeth Anne Bansavage, an actress in New York, was married yesterday to Edward John Potter, a business executive. The Rev. Warren Sterrett Beaven officiated at the Bellport (L.I.) United Methodist Church.

title: Review/Theater; Futile Wait for a Ferry to a Mystical Island
description: In the most famous scene in Brian Friel's "Dancing at Lughnasa," five Irish sisters in County Donegal, 1936, suddenly break loose from their household drudgery to explode in dance to the music pouring out of their new Marconi radio. The scene has a power transcending language. As if by magic, the women levitate in spiritual ecstasy even as every fact of their lives pulls them closer to poverty, heartbreak and death.

title: 'Write Me,' a Senator Says, And the People Take Heed
description: Senator Barbara Boxer of California has adopted as her theme song a ditty she remembers from the Perry Como show in the 1950's: "Letters, we get letters. We get stacks and stacks of letters."

title: United Federal Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain of $ 1,241,000, or 26 cents a share, from an accounting change.

title: Resource Bancshares Mortgage Group (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago per share earnings are not comparable because the company had its initial public offring on June 3.Per share earnings are based on the net earnings from June 3 through Sept. 30, divided by the weighted average number of shares outstanding, 10,825,000, subsequent to the offering.

title: Series Rating Drops From '92
description: The CBS telecast of Game 6 of the World Series Saturday night drew an overnight Nielsen rating in 29 markets of 20.0 with a 34 share. That's down 11 percent from last year's overnight rating of 22.6 and 40 for Game 6, which, like this year, was the final game of the Series. Toronto was the winner in both cases.

title: Don't Go Into Haiti Under Democracy Fig Leaf; U.S. Military Aid
description: To the Editor:

title: Corrections
description: Because of an editing error, an article on Thursday about the suicide of a Japanese right-wing militant misspelled the name of the newspaper executive in whose office it occurred. He is Toshitada Nakae.

title: Lord, Dentsu Chosen By Retail Chain
description: Home Base Inc., a home-improvement warehouse retail chain based in Fullerton, Calif., said it had selected Lord, Dentsu & Partners in Los Angeles to handle the creative and production portions of its $15 million to $20 million broadcast advertising account, which had been at the Colby Agency in Los Angeles since December 1991.

title: METRO DIGEST
description: NEW YORK CITY CONGENIALITY PLAYS ROLE IN CAMPAIGN For years, as he became a career master of indictment and conviction, Rudolph W. Giuliani could afford to treat likability as a secondary characteristic of private, not necessarily public, value. His defeat in 1989 changed that, he said. In this campaign, he is determined not to "play into that stereotype of a mechanical man." His success may determine the outcome of the vote. A1.

title: 5-Year-Old Boy Survives a 7-Story Fall
description: A 5-year-old boy fell from a window of his parents' Upper East Side apartment yesterday and survived a seven-story fall to a concrete courtyard below, officials said.

title: Kazakh Uses America To Enhance His Stature
description: The President of Kazakhstan played politics with the United States today and won.

title: CNB Bancshares (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain of $ 1,111,000, or 10 cents a share, from the cumulative effect on prior periods of an accountin change.Year-ago results were restated.Year-ago per share earnings were adjusted for a 10 percent stock dividend pain in January 1993.

title: Career Maverick Has a New Home at Conde Nast
description: When Conde Nast stunned the magazine industry in March by announcing the acquisition of Architectural Digest, the looming question was what would happen to Paige Rense, the 60-something editor in chief who has headed the magazine for 24 years.

title: Jiri Hajek, 80, Dies; Human Rights Aide And Czech Official
description: Jiri Hajek, the Foreign Minister of Czechoslovakia during the short-lived liberal reforms in 1968 that became known as the Prague Spring, died Friday in a hospital in Prague, the Reuters news agency reported. He was 80.

title: Black Women Writers
description: To the Editor:

title: Suzanne J. Groisser, Allen S. Keller
description: Suzanne Jacqueline Groisser, a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Victor W. Groisser of West Orange, N.J., was married to Dr. Allen Scott Keller, a son of Dr. and Mrs. Samuel S. Keller of Woodcliff Lake, N.J. Rabbi Jeshaia Schnitzer performed the ceremony at the Tamcrest Country Club in Alpine, N.J.

title: Market Place; A hot designer's planned offering still faces thorny issues.
description: ALTHOUGH many in the garment industry and on Wall Street doubted that it would happen, the Donna Karan Company is scheduled to offer the public a stake in its high-flying fashion business in the fourth week of November, according to Bear, Stearns & Company, the lead underwriter of the offering.

title: Midland Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain of $ 292,000, or 3 cents a share, on the sale of investments.c-Included a tax credit of $ 113,000, or 2 cents a share.d-Included a charge equal to 4 cents a share.

title: Patents
description: EVERY year, more than a million Americans require surgery to remove cataracts, opaque areas on the lens of the eye that cause blurred vision. The problem is especially common in the elderly, but cataracts can also result from eye injuries or diseases like diabetes.

title: Stacey L. Lane, Ira Arthur Pion
description: Dr. Stacey Laura Lane, a resident in psychiatry at the New York University Medical Center in New York, was married yesterday to Dr. Ira Arthur Pion, the chief resident in dermatology at the hospital. Rabbi Louis Frishman officiated at Temple Israel in Lawrence, L.I.

title: Loyola Capital (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain of $ 2,708,000, or 31 cents a share, from an accounting adjustment.Per share earnings and shares outstanding are fully diluted.

title: Diana Trilling at 88 Remembers, Rebukes And Ponders Marriage
description: "What does long life avail?" asked the poet Delmore Schwartz. "The best seats at the funerals of friends." It also offers the chance to set the record straight while having the last word.

title: Paolo Bortoluzzi Is Dead at 55; A Ballet Star and Choreographer
description: Paolo Bortoluzzi, an Italian dancer and choreographer, died on Oct. 16 in a hospital in Brussels. He was 55 years old.

title: Killers Indeed Fear Life More Than Death
description: To the Editor:

title: Advocate Candidate Steps Up Attacks on Rival
description: Susan D. Alter, the Republican-Liberal candidate for public advocate, intensified her attacks yesterday on her Democratic opponent, Mark J. Green, the former Consumer Affairs Commissioner. In recent days Ms. Alter has accused Mr. Green of unethical behavior as a commissioner, saying he used sheriffs to intimidate small-business owners into paying fines from the city.

title: Corrections
description: An article yesterday about the cloning of a human embryo misidentified the researcher in some copies. He is Dr. Jerry L. Hall, who works in the in vitro fertilization program at George Washington University Medical Center; Dr. Robert Stillman is director of the program.

title: Air France Chief Quits Amid Strike
description: Air France's chairman, Bernard Attali, resigned today as the state-owned French carrier suffered a seventh day of crippling strikes and the Government said a cost-cutting plan would have to be revised for the airline.

title: Review/Music; 'Figaro,' Played for Efficiency
description: Although long stigmatized for its sleepy productions of the standard repertory, the New York City Opera put on a "Nozze di Figaro" on Saturday afternoon that told a very different story. Saturday's performance -- and there will be four more through the rest of this month and into early November -- offered a model of limited resources turned to artistic advantage.

title: Sunrise Bancorp Inc.(NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a charge of $ 228,000 from a cumulative change in accounting for income taxes.Year-ago shares outstanding and per share earnings are not available because the company converted to stock form on April 5, 1993.Earnings per share in the latest 9 months are pro forma.

title: Details of U.S. Raid in Somalia: Success So Near, a Loss So Deep
description: At the time, the Oct. 3 raid into south Mogadishu by Army Rangers seemed like just another security sweep to round up troublemakers.

title: Bills Take Away a Lesson From Super Bowl
description: In a victory produced by forcing a total of four Jet fumbles and intercepted passes, the Bills continued today to erase the memory of their Super Bowl-record nine turnovers committed against the Cowboys.

title: Charles Decker, 51, Building-Code Expert
description: Charles M. Decker, a New Jersey state official who led national efforts for strong and uniform construction and building safety codes, including access for the handicapped, died on Thursday at a hospital in Livingston, N.J. He was 51 and lived in Tewksbury Township, N.J.

title: Networks Gain Riches From News Magazines
description: On Sunday, more Americans turn to "60 Minutes" than any other television show. By Monday, if they haven't had their fill of news magazines, they can turn to "Day One," ABC's newest entrant to the genre. And on Tuesday, there's more with "Dateline NBC"

title: Promotion At Wachovia
description: The Wachovia Corporation has announced the promotion of L. M. Baker Jr. to succeed John G. Medlin Jr. as chief executive, effective on Jan. 1.

title: Tara P. Davey, Joseph C. Rosa
description: Tara Patrice Davey, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph D. Davey of Carmel Valley, Calif., was married yesterday to Joseph Christopher Rosa, a son of Mr. and Mrs. William E. Rosa of Brooklyn. The Rev. Dennis Gilbert performed the Roman Catholic ceremony at the chapel on the campus of the Santa Catalina School in Monterey, Calif.

title: Vicki Vasilopoulos, Glenn Ball
description: Fredericka Vasilopoulos, the senior fashion editor at The Daily News Record, a men's wear trade publication, was married yesterday to Glenn Ball, an investor. Both work in New York.

title: Agencies Respond to Possible Bias Attack in Bronx
description: Police officals say they are investigating as a possible bias incident an attack on four eighth graders by a group of black teen-agers in Riverdale Friday afternoon.

title: Gateway Fed Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain of $ 1,638,000, or 84 cents a share, from an accounting adjustment.c-Included an extraordinary charge of $ 666,000 in the quarter and $ 747,000 in the 9 months, both from the early extinguishment elimination of debt.

title: INSIDE
description: Muting Good Economic News

title: Equity Issues This Week
description: The following equity and convertible debt offerings are expected this week:

title: Mandela, the Politician, Does as the Zulus Do
description: South Africans know Nelson Mandela as a cosmopolitan man who favors gray suits over skins and feathers and English over Xhosa, his native language. Some of his urbane lieutenants in the African National Congress scarcely hide their distaste for tribal rites.

title: Ami L. Weil, Todd A. Chanko
description: Dr. Ami Lisa Weil, a psychologist in Manhattan, was married yesterday to Todd Anthony Chanko, a television producer and film buyer for WNYC-TV in New York. Rabbi Marshall Meyer officiated at the 24 Fifth Avenue Ballroom, a catering establishment in New York.

title: Cragin Financial Corp.(NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain of $ 3,520,000, or 24 cents a share, from an accounting adjustment.

title: Big Ten Has a Run for the Roses Among Five Contenders
description: Florida State and Notre Dame, the No. 1 and No. 2 teams in The Associated Press and USA Today-CNN polls, remain on track for their match at South Bend, Ind., on Nov. 13, while the Big Ten has some big games this weekend.

title: Congress Defends Religious Freedom
description: Three years ago the Supreme Court threw away decades of precedent and watered down the religious liberty of all Americans. In a case involving the religious use of peyote by American Indians, the Court declared that states could criminalize all consumption of the substance without considering their laws' impact on the free exercise of religion.

title: People's Bank (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain of $ 15 million from a change in accounting for income taxes and a $ 7.3 million gain on sale of consumer loans, both of which were recorded in the first quarter.

title: Review/Television; Wisecracks and Angst: Fortyish Baby Boomers
description: "Dave's World" is a prime-time approximation of the world of Dave Barry, the humorist who writes his syndicated Pulitzer Prize-winning "Dave's World" column for The Miami Herald. While the sitcom, Mondays at 8:30 on CBS, is based on two Barry books, Mr. Barry pointedly keeps his distance from the series, not wanting the real Dave to be confused with the television version. Yeah, sure. Just keep those checks coming.

title: Corrections
description: A picture caption yesterday about the two orchestras conducted by Kurt Masur reversed the identities of two musicians shown hailing a cab. Christian Kretschmar was at the left and Hans Schlag at the center.

title: Investors Bank Corp.(NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain of $ 125,000, or 5 cents a share, from the adoption of FASB 109.

title: Edwards Shooting Way Into a Big Role With Nets
description: Derrick Coleman, recovering from root canal surgery, was still not with the Nets in Knoxville, Tenn., for their exhibition game last night against Larry Johnson and the Charlotte Hornets. It was Johnson's eight-year, $68-million contract extension just before camp that sparked Coleman's quest for a reported eight-year, $95 million extension.

title: Corrections
description: An article in Business Day on Tuesday about the stock of Spectrum Information Technologies Inc. misidentified the plantiffs in lawsuits that accuse Rafi Khan, a West Coast broker, of stock fraud and omitted the identity of the stock involved in the case. Mr. Khan was sued only by private investors, not the Securities and Exchange Commission; the case involved the stock of Future Communications Inc.

title: Review/Television; Losing Jobs and Hope In 'The Great Depression'
description: Experiences burned into the memories of those who endured America's toughest times are at the heart of "The Great Depression," a gritty seven-hour documentary that begins tonight on PBS. The producers, led by Henry E. Hampton ("Eyes on the Prize"), also make effective use of strong black-and-white newsreel clips from the 1920's and 30's, zesty folk songs and an intelligent narration, but it is the memories that give this history its punch and drive.

title: Health Proposal Could Leave Aliens in U.S. Without Care
description: At Su Clinica Familiar, the largest community health care center in the Rio Grande Valley, the issue of whether a patient is an illegal immigrant is met with a kind of "don't ask, don't tell" policy. If a pregnant women provides a utility bill or phone bill showing she has a local address, she is legally entitled to treatment, though only part of it is reimbursable to the clinic through Medicaid.

title: A Dinkins Bulwark in Queens
description: St. Albans is Dinkins country, where many residents feel the Mayor has done the best job in tough times and many feel he has empathized with the concerns of blacks. Page B3.

title: First Commercial Corp. (Ark.) (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said that the 1993 results reflected the its acquisition of Tyler Bank & and Trust and Lufkin National Bank in East Texas. The purchase of those banks was completed in February, and was accounted for as a purchase transaction.

title: Building Superindent Accused of Sodomy
description: A building superintendent sexually assaulted a 14-year-old in Brooklyn yesterday, forcing him into a building basement and sodomizing him, the police said.

title: 9 Lives, Powerful Thighs: Iraq's Quest Continues
description: The 1990's have been all about surviving for the Iraqi people. War, despotic leadership and United Nations sanctions: the Iraqis have seen them all.

title: Dykstra, a Winner, Goes Home a Loser
description: There was an element of disbelief in Lenny Dykstra's face as he sat with his back to the crowd, looking into his locker.

title: First Colonial Bankshares Corp.(NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
TRANSACTIONS
description: Saturday Football National Football League MIAMI DOLPHINS -- Activated Doug Pedersen, quarterback, from the practice squad. Waived Frankie Smith, cornerback.

title: Awards at Hamptons Film Festival
description: The first Hamptons International Film Festival came to an end yesterday with the presentation here of Golden Arrow Audience Awards for best film, best short and best director, and 10 Student Film Showcase Awards.

title: Jets Look Bad Again, But Insist They're Not
description: As the Jets continue their downward spiral, they are asking their fans: Who are you going to believe, us or your lying eyes?

title: Ethnic Shifts in Electorate Play Part in the Mayoral Riddle of Who Will Win
description: How can David N. Dinkins possibly win again when his margin over Rudolph W. Giuliani four years ago was less than 50,000 votes and when public opinion polls suggest that Hispanic and white liberal Dinkins voters are defecting?

title: Tikkanen Wins in Revival Meeting With Gretzky
description: When the Rangers play the Los Angeles Kings in this era, it is always a reunion of the Edmonton Oiler dynasty, with enough Stanley Cup rings around both locker rooms to trigger every airport metal detector from La Guardia to LAX.

title: Far East National Bank reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Bonnie Samuels, Dane Solomon
description: Bonnie Sue Samuels, a daughter of Daniel and Iris Samuels of Armonk, N.Y., was married yesterday to Dane Solomon, the son of Martin and Elaine Solomon of Merrick, L.I. Rabbi David Greenberg performed the ceremony at Temple Shaaray Tefila in Bedford, N.Y.

title: Auto Workers Gain Contract With G.M. Increasing Pensions
description: The General Motors Corporation and the United Automobile Workers tentatively agreed early this morning to a three-year labor contract that raises wages, enriches pensions and preserves health care benefits that are fully paid by the company.

title: Political Memo; Even Now, 1996 Calls To Many In G.O.P.
description: With a sly smile, Senator Phil Gramm of Texas offered a wholly unconvincing explanation for his arrival here tonight. "Actually," he said, "I was responding to Bob Dole, who said the weather was great up here this time of year."

title: Strong Sports Agency Key in Yankee Saga
description: In 1971, when the New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority set out to build its huge entertainment complex in the swamps of East Rutherford, it had one overarching priority: luring the New York Yankees away from the Bronx.

title: CHRONICLE
description: In Washington, MARLA ROMASH, director of communications for Vice President Al Gore, is on the move. She has become the Administration's chief spokeswoman for health care.

title: Metcalf Pushes Steelers Past Point of No Return
description: Eric Metcalf had injured his right knee in the Cleveland Browns' victory over Cincinnati last Sunday. So, in preparation last week for what in this city is Public Enemy No. 1 -- the Pittsburgh Steelers -- he did not practice on Monday. Or Tuesday. Or Wednesday. Or Thursday.

title: Don't Go Into Haiti Under Democracy Fig Leaf
description: To the Editor:

title: Give Science More Life, A Panel Urges Teachers
description: A commission appointed by an independent science organization will recommend sweeping changes today in science education in public schools, saying that existing curriculums try to cover too much, do not teach enough practical application of science and fail to integrate the subject with math and technology.

title: Ms. Steier, Mr. McNamara
description: Wendy Jane Steier, a daughter of Mildred Steier of Brooklyn and Herbert Steier of Baldwin Harbor, L.I., was married yesterday to Michael Joseph McNamara, a son of Mr. and Mrs. John F. McNamara of Mahopac, N.Y. Rabbi Albert Sturmer officiated at the Bear Mountain (N.Y.) Inn in Bear Mountain State Park.

description: b-Included a gain of $ 1,329,000, or 11 cents a share, from the adoption of a change in accounting for income taxes and a charge of $ 1,086,000 for expenses related to the acquisition of Summit Holding.

description: IS Rudolph W. Giuliani too mean to be mayor? Is David N. Dinkins too mild?

title: Chicago Gangs, Extending Turf, Turn to Politics
description: On a gray afternoon not long ago, Lu Palmer stood in the city's downtown business district watching thousands of young blacks march past, circle City Hall and stall traffic for blocks. They were ostensibly protesting Chicago's troubled school system, but a few also carried signs declaring it was time for another black mayor.

title: One Jury's Journey; Amid Case's Facts and a City's Fears, Seeking Rationale for Jurors' Findings
description: The verdicts in the city's second case of a videotaped beating, announced piecemeal last week by a jury trying to avoid a deadlock, have produced a new set of incongruous images to symbolize the social and racial dissonances of Los Angeles.

description: b-Included a gain of $ 1,452,000 from the adoption of accounting standard SFAS No. 109.

title: Dance in Review
description: Dianne McIntyre and Olu Dara Bessie Schonberg Theater

title: Fateful Decision: Staying to Guard a Pilot's Body
description: As the bullets and grenades whizzed through the streets of south Mogadishu on the night of Oct. 3, the Rangers made a fateful decision: after they retrieved two wounded soldiers from a downed Black Hawk helicopter, they stayed to guard the body of a dead pilot caught in the wreckage.

title: Boitano in Search of His Version of Bliss: One More Heavenly Day
description: He has made small, inevitable concessions to age and injury since that unearthly night when Brian Boitano felt "as if angels were lifting and spinning me" to a gold medal at the 1988 Winter Olympics. Once, he gave pet names to his individual gray hairs. Now, Boitano joked, he must name entire tufts.

title: Review/Music; Muy Caliente, Salsa Comes to the Garden
description: "Marlboro Music's Combinacion Perfecta," a salsa show at Madison Square Garden on Saturday night, had all sorts of significance, not the least of which was the nearly four hours of extraordinary music and vocal improvising it presented. No one looks on the present as a golden age, but the concert, which let a series of salsa's best vocalists challenge each other, argued that salsa is a genre overflowing with talent, and not all of it always heard on records.

title: Trans Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an accounting charge of $ 91,000 from the adoption of FASB No. 109.

title: Tension in Mogadishu
description: United Nations and United States peacekeepers in Somalia worried that there would be a new round of violence in the capital after the leader of one major faction refused to reroute a march set for Monday that is planned to go through the territory of the other major faction.

title: Politics Mirrors Diversity's Drive In the Suburbs
description: For decades Westchester and Nassau Counties have flourished as places of escape. And just as people left behind the frenzied harshness of city life, they also turned their backs on Democratic politics. In this century, Westchester and Nassau have each selected only one Democratic county executive, and Westchester has never had a Democratic district attorney.

title: Customized Radio Services Find More Air Time
description: Two companies best known for supplying traffic reports for radio station listeners, Shadow Broadcasting Service Inc. and its larger rival, Metro Networks Inc., are expanding their scope by offering customized news, weather and sports broadcasts to a growing number of radio stations.

title: People's Westchester Savings Bank (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain of $ 4,933,000, or 87 cents a share, from an accounting adjustment.The 1993 shares outstanding included 265,656 shares for the quarter and 285,788 shares for the 9 months of common stock option grants not yet exercised.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST
description: The Media Business

title: Mitchell Is 1 for 1 as the Dolphins' Starter
description: The throbbing question facing the Miami Dolphins tonight: Can they remain a title contender without Dan Marino, their record-busting passer?

title: Davis Makes His Case Down in Mexico City
description: Making a case that he should become the backup shooting guard, Hubert Davis (18 points) helped the Knicks to a 103-93 victory over the Houston Rockets tonight at the Sports Palace.

title: Two airlines promote images, not just fares, to win new customers.
description: DISCOUNTED air fares are as common these days as delayed flights out of Atlanta. American Airlines touched off a round of fare cuts to Europe last month. Northwest Airlines started another round of discounting over the weekend.

title: Dinkins Gathers Democratic Power Players for a Final Push
description: Rushing around New York City, with stops at a union hall in Flushing, Queens, the Abyssinian Baptist Church in Harlem and the Gurdwara Sikh Temple in Ozone Park, Queens, Mayor David N. Dinkins kicked off the final full week of the mayoral campaign yesterday by attacking Rudolph W. Giuliani as a hard-core Republican who lacks compassion for the homeless and tolerance for New York's diversity.

title: Helmut Gollwitzer Is Dead at 84; An Anti-Nazi German Theologian
description: Prof. Helmut Gollwitzer, a German Lutheran theologian who was an advocate for peace and human rights and an opponent of Nazism, died on Oct. 17 in Berlin. He was 84 years old and lived in Berlin.

title: Parkvale Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago results were restated to reflect an accounting change.

title: Treasury Plans to Auction Bills and Notes
description: The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills, and auctions of new two-year notes tomorrow and five-year notes on Wednesday, respectively.

title: No Larger NATO Now
description: The Czech Republic, Poland and Hungary want to join the North Atlantic Treaty Organization. But the Clinton Administration is right to say no for now. The Administration is instead offering all the countries of the former Soviet empire closer ties to NATO and holding open the possibility of eventual membership without setting a timetable.

title: One Valley Bancorp of W. Va. Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Tokyo Journal; What Great Grief Has Made the Empress Mute?
description: Even in a new age of openness for Japan, the subject is just too hot to touch, on television and in print. But for the last several days a single question has been whispered throughout the country: has the Japanese press driven Empress Michiko to the brink of a nervous breakdown?

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Television; Sun Sets on CBS Baseball Amid 'South of Sunset' Spots
description: CBS is long past the point of looking for silver linings in its four-year contract with Major League Baseball that ended Saturday night with the last pitch of the World Series. That deal, in fact, cost CBS just about every ounce of silver it owned -- along with gold, nickel and copper. CBS absorbed losses of about $500 million on the $1 billion contract.

title: Kara Unterberg, Roy Niederhoffer
description: Kara Jan Unterberg, a daughter of Seymour and Cynthia Unterberg of Westbury, L.I., was married yesterday to Roy Gary Niederhoffer, a son of Elaine Niederhoffer of Great Neck, L.I., and the late Dr. Arthur Niederhoffer. Rabbi Arthur Rulnick officiated at the Woodbury (L.I.) Jewish Center.

title: Canada Votes Today With Polls Suggesting a Victory by Liberals
description: Canada, whose 18.5 million eligible voters inhabit six time zones, chooses a new Parliament on Monday and appears virtually certain to end nine years of Progressive Conservative government.

title: First National Bancorp (Ga.) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Giuliani, Striving to Be Liked, Tries to Elude Shadow of '89
description: Rose Marie O'Keefe, Democratic state committeewoman and stalwart doyenne of the Bay Ridge party organization, saw the baby suddenly standing in the aisle of the American Legion hall, toddling up toward Rudolph W. Giuliani like an elfin litmus test as the mayoral candidate studiously made his argument to an overflow rainy-night crowd last Wednesday.

title: Joyful Molitor Is the Blue Jay With the Red Eyes
description: Paul Molitor might as well have been a teddy bear. Over and over again, different Blue Jays sought him out and hugged him. Over and over again. There was Dave Stewart. There was Joe Carter. There was Cito Gaston. Gaston was not crying until he saw the tears dripping from Molitor's eyes. So the manager cried, too.

title: Corrections
description: A headline in the Business section yesterday about a class action suit against Prudential Securities misstated the company's potential liability. The total of the Prudential Utility Fund's assets is $5.3 billion; there was no estimate of liability in the lawsuit, which contends that some investors were charged excessive fees.

title: FOR SARAJEVO JOB, A MOST BITTER MAN
description: To see the man expected to be named Prime Minister of Bosnia this week, the first essential is a flashlight to negotiate the darkened stairwells and corridors of the main Government building in Sarajevo, known as the Presidency.

title: Oriental Federal Savings Bank reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago per share earnings were adjusted for a 3-for-2 stock split paid in August.

title: Safeco Corp.(NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a charge of $ 26 million for a Proposition 103 settlement in both tthe quarter and 9 months, and the 9 months also included a gain of $ 2,877,000, or 5 cents a share, from an accounting change in the 9 months.

title: Sports of The Times; A Gladiator In That Dark Valley
description: I N the savage world of football, American civilization's substitute for the Peloponnesian War, it was a routine play in Giants Stadium Sunday, a normal collision of 300-pounders, or thereabouts, and one that resulted in a player going down and writhing in pain on the green playing floor. Common enough.

title: Cheesecake Factory (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 3
description: Year-ago results are for period ended Sept. 30, 1992.Year-ago share earnings and shares outstanding are pro forma to reflect an adjustment to eliminate certain compensation.

title: Clinton and Mubarak Differ on Israel-Syria Timing
description: President Clinton and President Hosni Mubarak of Egypt differed today on how quickly to press Israel and Syria to reach a settlement in the wake of the breakthrough between Israel and the Palestinians.

title: Ogilvy & Mather Drops Shell as Client
description: Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide said yesterday that its Houston office had resigned a new credit card account from the Shell Oil Company, citing a conflict with American Express, a client of Ogilvy in New York. Shell billings were estimated at $5 million to $10 million.

title: Ross Systems
description: Shares of Ross Systems Inc., a software maker based in Redwood City, Calif., plunged yesterday in heavy Nasdaq trading after the company posted an unexpected loss for its fiscal first quarter because of sluggish international sales and higher expenses. The stock had been edging up steadily since midsummer.

title: Carter Wallace reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a charge of $ 43,819,000 from an accounting adjustment.c-Net income and included income of $ 6 million after taxes, or 13 cents a share, recorded in the first quarter ended June 30, 1992 related to a licensing agreement with Schering-Plough Corp.Latest sales for the latest quarter reflect lower foreign exchange rates in the current year periods ended Sept. 30, 1993 had the effect of reducing sales in comparison with the prior year. In the quarter ended Sept. 30, 1993, lower foreign exchange rates accounted for $ 7.6 million, or 45 percent, of the sales decline. The effect of changes in foreign exchange rates reduced results of operations in the quarter ended Sept. 30, 1993 by 1 cent a share.Latest sales for the latest 6 months reflect lower foreign exchange rates in the latest period had the effect of reducing sales in comparison with the prior year. The effect of changes in foreign exchange rates reduced results of operations in the 6 months ended Sept. 30, 1993 by 2 cents a share.Carter Wallace Inc. said during the quarter ended Sept. 30, 1993 it adjusted its net deferred tax asset to reflect the recently enacted change in corporate income tax rates. Income taxes in the quarter and 6 months ended Sept. 30, 1993 included a credit of $ 815,000, or 2 cents a share.

title: A Parched Town In a Water-Rich State; Distribution Woes Plague Greenwich
description: For all its woodsy wealth, its understated downtown of bistros and boutiques and its ability to calculate millionaires per square mile, this corner of Fairfield County has a very humbling and down-to-earth problem: water.

title: Present at the Transition of I.B.M.
description: He has perhaps the toughest management job in America and he's an I.B.M. executive, but he is not the company's new chief executive, Louis V. Gerstner Jr.

title: Lemaire Succeeding as Private Man in a Public Arena
description: The coach likes to teach his sport to his players, but he doesn't appreciate the skeptical attention of the news media and he doesn't seek the fickle approval of the fans. So where does he go to pursue his career?

title: Corrections
description: Because of an editing error, an article in Business Day yesterday, about the administrator overseeing the settlement of fraud charges against Prudential Securities, referred incompletely to the limited partnerships involved in the case. The partnerships, which were valued at more than $8 billion, included investments in real estate and other areas, as well as in energy.

title: Washington Memo; Economic Outlaw: American Health Care
description: In health care today, fundamental principles of the marketplace do not apply.

title: RESULTS PLUS
description: HOCKEY Wings Double Losers The Detroit Red Wings lost a game last night, by 5-3 to Dallas as the Stars' Dean Evason had a goal and two assists. They also lost a proud attendance mark by drawing just 19,004 fans, breaking a string of 133 regular-season sellouts. The Red Wings had filled the 19,275 seats at Joe Louis Arena for every game since late in the 1989-90 season. The Red Wings outshot Dallas, 24-13, but allowed the Stars several uncontested short-range goals, scoring four times against Vincent Riendeau on eight shots and forcing him to the bench in the second period.

title: Holy Bull Produces Brilliant Encore
description: Maybe it was no fluke, after all. The 2-year-old colt Holy Bull, who ended the winning streak of the superstar Dehere last month, rose to even greater heights on Saturday when he won the $400,000 Florida Stallion Stakes by 7 1/2 lengths.

title: University National Bank reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Afternoon Session of Bomb Trial Is Canceled
description: The judge in the World Trade Center bombing trial abruptly canceled the afternoon's testimony yesterday and sealed the record of an out-of-court conference in which he reached the decision to postpone the trial until today.

title: FirstFed Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income and included an accounting gain of $ 3,075,000.

title: Rodney D. Andrews, Expert on Polymers And a Professor, 71
description: Rodney D. Andrews Jr., an expert in the chemistry of polymers, died on Oct. 19 at St. Mary's Hospital in Hoboken, N.J. He was 71 and lived in Weehawken.

title: AT&T Capital Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included adjustment to deferred tax balances of $ 11.8 million from increase in corporate tax rate in both the quarter and 9 months.c-After a charge of $ 2,914,000 from an accounting adjustment.

title: Newark Schools Report Counters State Findings
description: The Newark school system, under threat of a state takeover and reeling from months of public criticism, has prepared a rebuttal that deals point by point with the state's harsh assessment.

title: Lawsuit On Sex Bias Goes to Jury
description: Jurors retired yesterday to decide if Goldman, Sachs & Company was guilty of sex discrimination.

title: Yield on 30-Year Bond Rises to 6%
description: The yield on the 30-year Treasury bond jumped to 6 percent yesterday amid uncertainty about the outlook for economic growth, inflation and interest rates.

title: Detroit Edison Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Haiti's Premier and General Meet as Drive to Settle Crisis Intensifies
description: Haiti's military commander and the Prime Minister appointed by the exiled President met today for the second time in three days as international efforts to settle the political crisis here intensified.

title: Bay View Capital (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an extraordinary gain of $ 3,000 in the quarter and an extraordinary loss of $ 132,000 in the 9 months, each resulting from penalties for early retirement of debt, net of income tax.c-Included extraordinary losses of $ 159,000 in the quarter and 9 months, each resulting from penalties for early retirement of debt, net of income tax. Also included a gain of $ 4,197,000, or 61 cents a share, from an accounting adjustment in the 9 months.

title: New York City Elections; Mark Green for Public Advocate
description: We endorse the Democrat Mark Green over both Susan Alter, the Republican-Liberal candidate, and Ronald Reale, a Conservative, in the race for public advocate -- a job in search of a definition. As we said during the crowded Democratic primary, which Mr. Green won over Ms. Alter, Mr. Reale and three other candidates, the voluble Mr. Green is so enthusiastic about public service that he might actually find a rationale for a city post that now has little meaning.

title: Clinic Chain Seeks a Deal With a Rival
description: Surgical Care Affiliates Inc., bidding to build a nationwide network of 146 walk-in surgery centers, said yesterday that it had offered to merge with Medical Care America, a troubled competitor, in a stock swap valued at $941 million.

title: QVC's Move Is Awaited As Viacom Begins Bid
description: Amid a flurry of hastily convened news conferences and analysts' meetings, Viacom Inc. began its $10 billion tender offer for Paramount Communications Inc. yesterday. But Wall Street's attention remained focused on Viacom's nemesis, QVC Network Inc.

title: Led by Cyclicals, Dow Breaks Record
description: Blue-chip stocks galloped to new highs yesterday, but they failed to coax along the rest of the market, which seemed edgy.

title: CB Bancshares reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a charge of $ 580,000 from an accounting adjustment.The company said that its earnings per share declined in the latest third quarter because of an increased number of shares outstanding due to a 575,000-common share offer completed in the latest second quarter. Average share figures weren't immediately available.

title: Executive Changes
description: AMERICAN STOCK EXCHANGE, New York, appointed Mark Klein executive director of the Emerging Company Marketplace. IDEXX LABORATORIES, Westbrook, Me., named Erwin Workman Jr. president and a director.

title: College Soccer Report
description: Atlantic Coast Conference The Virginia Cavaliers, who won the the last two national championships, have been struggling late in the season just like they did last year.

title: Dr. Ernest B. Howard, A.M.A. Executive, 83
description: Dr. Ernest B. Howard, a retired executive for the American Medical Association, died on Friday at the Northwest Community Care Center in Arlington Heights, Ill. He was 83 and lived in Inverness, a suburb of Chicago.

title: No Headline
description: "It's a dangerous turn, trying to create the perfect child and then duplicating it. What do you do if you don't like the first child? Throw the cloned embryo away?" -- DR. EDWARD L. MARUT, medical director of the in vitro fertilization center at Michael Reese Hospital in Chicago. [ C3:5. ]

title: Investors Jam Prudential Fraud Line
description: Investors throughout the country continued yesterday to deluge state securities regulators with telephone calls seeking information about the huge fraud settlement last week by Prudential Securities.

title: Bridge
description: A finesse is decided by what the expert on defense didn't do, and what that meant.

title: New York City Elections; Alan Hevesi for Comptroller
description: In the race for city comptroller, we urge New Yorkers to support Assemblyman Alan Hevesi over his chief opponent, the Republican-Liberal Herman Badillo. A Conservative, Howard Lim Jr., is also in the race, but the contest centers on Mr. Hevesi and Mr. Badillo -- two unusually intelligent candidates who are both well versed in government.

title: Indiana Federal reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain of $ 750,000, or 23 cents a share, from the favorable resolution of an Internal Revenue Service refund claim in both the quarter and 9 months.c-Included a non-recurring after tax gain of $ 285,000, or 9 cents a share, on the sale of mortgage-backed securities in both the quarter and 9 months, and the 9 months also included a gain of $ 250,000, or 8 cents a share, from an accounting adjustment.

title: Knocked Out by the Freshmen
description: Perpetually teetering on the edge in Washington's annual budget battles, the superconducting supercollider had managed to survive one brush with death after another like an alley cat with extra spring in its legs.

title: Cincinnati Bell reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary charge for early extinguishment of debt of $ 1,672,000 in both the quarter and 9 months.Cincinnati Bell Inc. said the latest 9 months' earnings included a gain of 10 cents a share from the sale of the residential equipment line of business, and year-ago 9 months included a gain of 5 cents a share from an amendment to a Cincinnati Bell Telephone marketing agency relationship.

title: Ladd Furniture Inc.(NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 2
description: Year-ago results are restated to reflect the adoption of SFAS 109.

title: Jury Inquiry Into Lopez
description: A Federal grand jury here is examining evidence that an executive of the General Motors Corporation took company secrets with him when he defected to Volkswagen A.G. last spring, lawyers for the executive and Volkswagen said today.

title: Some Aren't Just Eligible, They Are Officially Free
description: Most of the premier players on the list of free agent eligibles sent a message to their clubs yesterday. To show that they were serious about the possibility of moving elsewhere, they filed for free agency on the first day they could.

title: Landmark Bancorp (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Landmark Bancorp said its latest third quarter earnings were bolstered by the previously reported receipt of a $ 1.3 million settlement from its insurance company, resulting from losses associated with unauthorized advances of funds by an officer of Landmark Bank.The bank said it posted the settlement amount as a recovery against losses originally charged off in 1991 through the allowance for credit losses, inflating the allowance.

title: A World With O'Neal?
description: SHAQUILLE O'NEAL will likely play at next summer's world championships in Toronto despite a sponsorship conflict that so far has kept him off the United States national team.

title: School Evacuated in Fire
description: About 550 students and more than 150 school employees had to be evacuated from a Brooklyn elementary school yesterday afternoon when a small fire sent smoke through hallways and classrooms, fire officials said. The fire, at Public School 106 in Bushwick, was confined to a closet in an empty fourth-floor classroom and was declared suspicious, said a Fire Department spokesman, Jerry Sanford. Five adults suffered minor smoke inhalation during the fire, which began about 12:50 P.M. and was brought under control at 1:40 P.M., Mr. Sanford said. The school, at 1314 Putnam Avenue, is in the midst of an asbestos abatement program.

title: Commerce Bank (Va.) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said that it recorded a non-recurring noncash charge to earnings of $ 910,000 for the writedown of an intangible asset in the latest quarter.

title: COMPANY BRIEFS
description: BLACK & DECKER CORP., Towson, Md., said it had sold its Dynapert printed circuit board assets to the Universal Instruments division of the Dover Corp., New York. The terms were not disclosed. CALIFORNIA MICROWAVE INC., Sunnyvale, Calif., said it signed a definitive agreement with Telesciences Inc. to acquire its Telesciences Transmission Systems Inc. unit for $28.7 million.

title: Though Sikh Rebellion Is Quelled, India's Punjab State Still Seethes
description: For a decade, the Indian state of Punjab has witnessed the most violent of India's many sectarian and ethnic conflicts, with a rebellion by Sikh separatists that led to the assassination of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi and posed perhaps the most serious threat to Indian national unity.

title: Accounts
description: * CNBC, Fort Lee, N.J., to Kirshenbaum & Bond, New York. Advertising for the business cable television network of NBC was most recently handled by an in-house team and various shops on a project basis. BBDO New York was the last agency of record. Billings were estimated at $5 million. * Fordham University Graduate School of Business Administration, New York and Tarrytown, N.Y., to Mad Dogs & Englishmen, New York, to handle advertising for the school's M.B.A. program, previously handled by Severin & Associates, New York. Billings were not disclosed. * Video Monitoring Services of America, New York, to Katz Dochtermann & Epstein, New York, to handle advertising for the broadcast retrieval company, previously handled in-house. Billings were not disclosed. * Wellfleet Communications Inc., Billerica, Mass., narrowed the review on its $1.5 million account, previously at Saabe & Co., Providence, R.I., to three Boston-based finalists: Clarke Goward Fitts Matteson, Duval Woglom Brueckner & Partners and Rossin Greenberg Seronick. * Whirlpool Corp., Benton Harbor, Mich., to Kobs & Draft Worldwide, Chicago, as the first agency to handle direct marketing for the introduction of the Whirlpool Water Source System. Billings were not disclosed. * Keyfile Corp., Nashua, N.H., to Rossin Greenberg Seronick, Boston, to handle advertising and direct marketing for the software company, previously handled in-house. Billings were estimated at $1.2 million.

title: GOVERNING TORIES IN CANADA ROUTED BY LIBERAL PARTY
description: The Liberal Party, led by Jean Chretien, a Quebec lawyer and former Cabinet minister, steamrolled to victory in elections Monday that foreshadowed major changes in Canada's political landscape.

title: First Citizens BancStock reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago results are pro forma and are restated to reflect a 5-for-1 stock split effective May 1993.

title: CHRONICLE
description: "I'm drenched emotionally, I have felt like crying 50 different times this evening," RED BUTTONS said as he stood on a red, white and blue balloon-festooned bar at Mortimer's on Sunday addressing a 50th reunion of people involved in the World War II show "Winged Victory."

title: Composting Promotes A Cleaner, Greener City
description: To the Editor:

title: Alabama Passer Injured
description: Alabama quarterback JAY BARKER, who suffered a badly sprained shoulder in last week's game, is not expected to play against Southern Mississippi this weekend, Coach GENE STALLINGS said yesterday.

description: b-Included charge of 8 cents a share for tax provisions related to higher taxes under new federal income tax law for both the quarter and 6 months, and the 6 months also included a gain of $ 4,900,000, or 29 cents a share, from a change in accounting for income taxes.

title: Baskin-Robbins Picks an Agency
description: Baskin-Robbins U.S.A. said yesterday that it had selected D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles in Los Angeles to handle its account, which had been at Asher/Gould in Los Angeles for the last five years. Billings were estimated at $13 million.

title: BancFirst Ohio Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included securities gains of $ 258,000 in the quarter and $ 357,000 in the 9 months.c-Included securities gains of $ 96,000.

title: Three Heroines and a Woman They Love to Hate
description: The Robber Bride By Margaret Atwood 466 pages. Nan A. Talese/Doubleday. $23.50.

Unocal Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a charge of $ 14 million representing the effect of higher federal income tax rates on deferred taxes in the quarter and the 9 months included a charge of $ 130,000,000 from the cumulative effect of accounting changes.c-After restructuring charges of $ 32 million in the quarter and the 9 months included a gain of $ 24,000,000, or 10 cents a share, from the cumulative effect of accounting changes.

title: Lord Grimond, 80, Led Liberals In Britain in the 1950's and 60's
description: Lord Grimond, a charismatic leader of Britain's Liberal Party in the 1950's and 1960's, died on Sunday in his home on the Orkney Islands, off the north coast of Scotland. He was 80.

title: Environment Ebbs as Suffolk Issue
description: In a county Legislature once known for bold initiatives to preserve the environment, Nora Bredes may be the last of her kind: an unabashed environmentalist.

title: Corner-Cutting Runner Is Still Declared Winner
description: DOMINIQUE BARIOD of France, the first-place finisher in the Marine Corps Marathon on Sunday, was declared the official winner yesterday of the Washington race despite "uncontested evidence" he veered off course. Race officials said he did not gain an unfair advantage over any other runner.

title: Corrections
description: An article yesterday about the mayoral campaign of Rudolph W. Giuliani misstated the party affiliation of one of his supporters, Rose Marie O'Keefe of Bay Ridge, Brooklyn. She is a Republican state committeewoman, not a Democrat.

title: Vermont Financial Services Corp.(NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Included a charge of $ 2.3 million allocated as a reserve for disposition of foreclosed property, in anticipation of a scheduled auction of bank-owned real estate. Securities gains of $ 942,000 in the quarter partially offset the effect of the reserve. The company said that in its Oct. 9 auction of bank-owned real estate it sold 74 of 79 available properties for $ 5.6 million, about $ 290,000 below carrying value of the properties. The company will reflect that amount, plus auction expenses of $ 460,000, in its fourth quarter results.

title: Hamilton Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Share earnings were not available; the company converted to a stock savings institution April 1, 1993.

title: Vikings Intercept Bears at The Pass
description: Minnesota and Chicago played one of those forgetful games tonight where dropped balls and missed blocking assignments and close-to-the-vest play-calling made for a long, tedious affair. When it was finally over, the Vikings had a 19-12 victory and moved one game behind the Detroit Lions in the National Football Conference's Central Division with a 4-2 record.

title: G.M. Joins In Rising Auto Sales
description: Sales of cars and light trucks built in North America climbed 18.4 percent in mid-October, auto makers reported today, helped by a rebound for the General Motors Corporation from earlier production difficulties.

title: Amfed Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain of $ 787,000, or 17 cents a share, from the adoption of SFAS 109.Year-ago results are not relevant because Amfed Financial was a mutual institution that converted to a stock company Nov. 20, 1992.Share earnings and shares outstanding are fully diluted.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; The tobacco industry seeks to assure America that it's against underage smoking, too.
description: SINCERITY is rarely a trait ascribed to the tobacco industry, unless the context is Congressmen from tobacco districts fighting higher taxes on tobacco.

description: b-Net loss

title: Nova Vicosa Journal; Art From the Amazon's Ashes Is Arousing Brazil
description: Deep in the forest, the woodsman with splayed peasant's toes and a graying hermit's beard descended from his treehouse and recounted a visit he made last year to the elegant galleries of the Museum of Modern Art in Rio de Janeiro.

title: Loctite Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included $ 12,740,000 pretax charge for restructuring costs.

title: Tremors Reported In Part of 2 States
description: Dozens of anxious residents in Mommouth County, N.J., and in Suffolk County, L.I., called local police stations last night to report a loud explosion followed by a tremor that resembled an earthquake.

title: Duran Duran Cancels
description: Duran Duran has postponed its concerts tonight, tomorrow and Friday at Radio City Music Hall because Simon LeBon, the singer, has torn a vocal cord. Duran Duran is trying to reschedule the concerts and plans an announcement for ticketholders next week. For refunds, see the ticket seller. Information: (212) 247-4777.

title: Vallone Calls For Changing School Repair
description: Attributing the decline in the maintenance of New York City public schools to "muddled bureaucracy" more than chronic underfinancing, City Council Speaker Peter Vallone yesterday said he would oppose additional maintenance money until the system for making repairs is overhauled.

title: Black & Decker Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 3
description: b-Net loss and after an extraordinary charge of $ 2,100,000 from early retirement of debt and a net charge of $ 237,600,000 which included charge of $ 249.8 million for postretirement benefits accounting changes, and gain of $ 12.2 million, or 17 cents a share, for income tax accounting change.Year-ago results are restated to reflect changes in accounting for postretirement benefits.

title: Joseph Driscoll, 70; Educator Opposed Antiwar Protesters
description: Joseph L. Driscoll, the president of Southeastern Massachusetts University who attracted national attention for his fight against student and faculty opposition to the Vietnam War, died on Friday at his home in Sandwich, Mass. He was 70.

title: Jordan's Role in Israeli-Palestinian Peace Effort; To Invigorate Economy
description: To the Editor:

title: Liza A. Bosworth, 35, Partner in a Law Firm
description: Liza Anne Bosworth, a partner in a Manhattan law firm, died on Oct. 18 in San Francisco, where she was on a business trip. She was 35 and lived in Manhattan.

title: Famous Line Was 'Quiet!' Not 'Shut Up!
description: Almost ever since election night four years ago, Rudolph W. Giuliani has been haunted by his image as an agitated candidate shouting "shut up" at his supporters when some of them began booing at the very mention of David N. Dinkins's name.

title: Safeguard Scientifics Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company reported gains on sales of securities of $ 453,000 in the latest quarter compared with $ 337,000 in the year-ago period.

title: For Harding, Not All Sequins and Music
description: Tonya Harding skates to music from "Jurassic Park," perhaps feeling that if fictional dinosaurs can be resurrected, so can her unfulfilled career.

title: Haitian Radio Host, Backer of Aristide, Is Killed in Miami
description: A popular Haitian radio broadcaster and local community leader who supported the ousted Haitian President, the Rev. Jean-Bertrand Aristide, was killed on Sunday night in the parking lot of a school here.

title: Corrections
description: An obituary on Saturday about Edward C. Perry, a financial adviser who died on Thursday in Manhattan, misspelled the names of a company for which he worked, and of his companion. The company is the Encyclopaedia Britannica. His companion is Adolfo Sardina, the fashion designer known as Adolfo.

description: Pavel Berman and Lazar Berman Violinist and Pianist Carnegie Hall

description: In percent

title: Red Sox Drop Coaches
description: The Boston Red Sox will not renew the contracts of pitching coach RICH GALE, first-base coach AL BUMBRY or third-base coach RICK BURLESON for next season, the team said last night. A spokesman said the decision to drop the three coaches does not affect the status of Manager BUTCH HOBSON, who is signed through the end of 1994.

title: Crane Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a special charge of $ 24.4 million.

description: b-Net lossHowell Hydrocarbons & Chemicals Inc. reported earnings of $ 286,000 for the 1993 third quarter and earnings of $ 237,000 for the 1993 9-months period.Howell Petroleum reported earnings of $ 1,815,000 for the quarter.

title: Exxon Posts Record Net For Quarter
description: The Exxon Corporation yesterday reported record third-quarter earnings, helped by gains from asset sales and lower tax rates overseas.

description: b-After a $ 9.1 million pretax gain from the sale of Reneer Films.c-After an extraordinary charge of $ 14,600,000 from early retirement of debt.d-Net loss and after a net charge of $ 1,010,600,000 which included loss of $ 1,065,700,000 from accounting for non-pension post-retirement benefits and gain of $ 55.1 million from cumulative effect of change in accounting for income taxes.Share earnings reflects a 2-for-1 stock split paid May 4.

description: Tax expense in the latest quarter was $ 179,000 compared with a tax benefit of $ 1.1 million in the year-ago quarter.

description: b-Inlcuded a gain of $ 3,369,000 from the sale of the company's stake in Photo Engravers and Electrotypers Ltd., which was used to offset expenses incurred in the conversion of the company's catalogue stores to agencies.The company is listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange.Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: BIOSPHERICS SHARES SOAR ON PLANS FOR SWEETENER
description: Shares of Biospherics Inc. soared 72 percent after the company said it would try to market D-tagatose, its low-calorie sugar substitute, outside the United States. Biospherics received a patent on a method to produce D-tagatose in 1991, and company officials have previously said they hoped to receive marketing approval from the Food and Drug Administration by 1997 or 1998. Shares of Biospherics rose $4.50 yesterday, to $10.75, in Nasdaq trading. The company, based in Beltsville, Md., is also involved in environmental testing and information services in health and education.

title: ACX Technologies Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss and the 9 months included a charge of $ 12,454,000 from an accounting adjustment.Year-ago shares outstanding are not applicable. Company's capital structure prior to its spinoff from Adolph Coors Co. is not indicative of the current capital structure.

title: Dentsply International (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included after-tax charges of $ 16,450,000 mainly for transaction costs relating to merger between Gendex Corp. and Dentsply, and for charges associated with the bankruptcy of a major distributor during the second quarter.

title: Oklahoma Gas & Electric reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Menotti Leaves Spoleto U.S.A.
description: In what has become virtually an annual ritual, the composer Gian Carlo Menotti announced on Sunday evening that he was severing his ties with the board and management of Spoleto Festival U.S.A., the arts festival he founded 17 years ago in Charleston, S.C. In previous skirmishes, Mr. Menotti, the festival's artistic director, presented demands and ultimatums and the festival's board acquiesced, but this time reconciliation seems unlikely.

title: Davis Lifts Game, and Chances of Game Time
description: If Hubert Davis becomes the primary backup for John Starks, mark down Sunday's performance as a turning point.

title: Airlines Discount Domestic Fares Up to 40%
description: Major airlines cut fares yesterday up to 40 percent on domestic routes, thus matching the discounts announced by Northwest Airlines late Saturday. The sale lasts through Friday.

title: One Smile (Only One) Can Lift A Mood
description: AS smiles are beginning to come under precise study, researchers report that not just any happy face will actually make the smiler feel happy. A polite smile, a smile of feigned enjoyment or a grin-and-bear-it grimace will not give the physiological lift that accompanies a genuine grin.

title: Ashland Oil reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a net gain of $ 18 million, or 28 cents a share, due mainly to the effect of tax law changes on 38 percent owned Ashland Oil, Inc.c-Net loss and special charges and accounting changes reduced fourth quarter net by $ 115 million, or $ 1.95 a share, and the year included a charge of $ 267,442,000 from cumulative effect of accounting change.

title: Zenith Laboratories (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss

title: Corrections
description: The "On Stage, and Off" column in Weekend on Friday misidentified the talent agency for which Wiley Hausem, the new director of public affairs for the New York Shakespeare Festival, worked previously. It was International Creative Management, not the William Morris Agency.

title: S. I. College Loses Chief After Dispute
description: The president of the College of Staten Island was dismissed yesterday by the board of trustees of the City University of New York, after months of rancorous dispute between the official and CUNY Chancellor W. Ann Reynolds.

title: The Golf and Tennis Caucus Gets Busy
description: Less than a week ago, the House seemed ready to take a modest but welcome step to free itself from the grasp of special interests. A House Judiciary subcommittee was about to finish legislation setting a $20 limit on gifts from any one source, including meals. Also on the table were the lobbyist-financed golf and tennis vacations to which many members are addicted, and a provision requiring full disclosure of all the financial benefits from lobbyists not barred by the bill.

title: Review/Art; Trying to Balance the Art and the Architecture
description: Museums have art and they have real estate, and often they think the way to bring attention to the former is to make more of the latter.

title: Thais' Work in Libya Brings a U.S. Warning
description: The United States has warned Thailand that Thai companies are now the principal foreign contractors involved in the construction of chemical weapons plants in Libya, American and Thai officials say.

title: San Diego Gas & Electric reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Spiegel Inc.(NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a one-time after-tax charge of $ 21.9 million for the closing of certain catalog distribution facilities in both the quarter and 9 months.c-Net income and the 9 months included a gain of $ 4,101,000, or 4 cents a share, from the cumulative effect of accounting changes.

description: b-Included a charge of $ 402,000 from the cumulative effect of an accounting change.
